key_points: Joshua Ziminski charged with felony arson and other misdemeanors after events during Kenosha protests.
Ziminski accused of firing a shot in the air before Kyle Rittenhouse fatally shot Joseph Rosenbaum, leading to the dismissal of an earlier case.
Ziminski, seen in videos with victim Rosenbaum before the chase and shooting by Rittenhouse, faces new legal issues.
On Aug. 25, Ziminski allegedly attempted to block police and started a large trash bin fire at a gas station.
Ziminski also seen manipulating the fire of an overturned, burning trailer blocking police.
Kelly Ziminski, Joshua's wife, charged with disorderly conduct, resisting an officer, and curfew violation, with a pretrial conference scheduled.
Ziminski supporters claim his shot fired was the 'first shot,' potentially leading Rittenhouse to believe he was being attacked.
Both Joshua and Kelly Ziminski involved in confrontation with police during protests.
Kyle Rittenhouse pleads not guilty to homicide among other counts, claiming self-defense in the shootings of Rosenbaum, Huber, and Grosskreutz.
The case brings attention back to the Kenosha protests and the incidents of violence that occurred.
